sentences.english: I never believed until then that any meal could defeat me.
sentences.chinese: 在那之前我從來也不相館飯食能夠難倒我。

sentences.english: It's a real sell: the food seems cheap but you pay extra for vegetables.
sentences.chinese: 真哄人，飯食彷彿很廉價，但是喫菜還得另付錢呢。

sentences.english: Good food, good exercise and good habits.
sentences.chinese: 飯食合理，積極鍛鍊，再加上良好的習慣。

sentences.english: She always complains to her parents about the school meals.
sentences.chinese: 她總向父母抱怨學校的飯食。

sentences.english: There is special food for the sick in our dining-room.
sentences.chinese: 我們餐室有專門爲病人準備的飯食。

sentences.english: You get pretty good food there.
We have lunch in the cantine. The price of thfe food there is reasonable.
sentences.chinese: 我們在食堂喫午飯，那兒的飯食價格很合理。

sentences.english: Most are just simple variations on a few favorite meals.
sentences.chinese: 大部分都是一些喜愛的飯食中的簡單變化。

sentences.english: Their meals included many different meats.
sentences.chinese: 他們的飯食包括許多不同的肉。

sentences.english: In that factory the company provides free meals as a fringe benefit.
sentences.chinese: 公司在那個工廠裏供給免費飯食作爲一種福利補貼。

definition: to act in a play/to put on a play
to eat one's fill/to be full
variant of 滷味|卤味[lu3 wei4]
convenient/handy/easy/bento (a meal in a partitioned box)/lunchbox
dragon boat (used at 端午[Duan1 wu3], the Dragon Boat Festival)
joking matter/to go back on one's words
